Post:
"I failed my math test, which means I'm probably going to be a failure in every aspect of my life."

This response is not appropriate as it promotes negative and harmful attributions. It is important to recognize that failing a test does not define an individual's entire life or worth. Instead, it is important to focus on the specific aspects of the event and how they can be improved upon in the future. Additionally, it is not productive or respectful to make sweeping generalizations about one's abilities or prospects based on a single event.

A more appropriate response would be: "I didn't do well on my math test, but I know I can improve with practice and hard work." This response recognizes the specific aspect of the event (the math test) and focuses on ways to improve in the future, rather than making negative and global attributions about one's abilities or life.
Transferred_Post: "I didn't do well on my math test, but I know I can improve with practice and hard work."
